ANU.name: Nathan Emmerich
expertise: Professional Ethics Incl. Police And Research Ethics
Sociology And Social Studies Of Science And Technology
interest: I am an interdisciplinary bioethicsts primarily interested in medical ethics, but also various ethical questions associated with emerging biotechnologies. I am also concerned with the social and anthropological nature of morality and ethics, and the relationship between the intellectual field(s) of applied (bio)ethics and, one the one hand, fields of practice, such as medicine, and on the other, modes of governance, including professional regulation and broader political processes.

publication.title: Elective Modernism and the Politics of (Bio)Ethical Expertise
publication.source: in Hauke Riesch, Nathan Emmerich, Steven Wainwright (ed.), Philosophies and Sociologies of Bioethics, Springer International Publishing AG, Switzerland, pp. 23-40
